channel.title: Featured Projects on Baihan Yang
channel.description: Recent content in Featured Projects on Baihan Yang

item.title: Data Science Certification Project
item.description: As part of the certification for Datacamp, I had to complete a case study project for a fitness class attendance problem. Clean and validate a 150 rows by 8 columns dataset Analyze the data before we start modeling for class imbalance and various distributions of the features Determine type of problem and choose base model (LogisticRegression) and comparison model(RandomForestRegression) Tune my RandomFroestRegression model with a grid search and train both models on the training dataset Assess the performance of my models with the test data months as members vs.

item.title: Next Project: Chinese to English Neural Network
item.description: In my free time, I do some chinese to english translations for LEMCNSUN on their game Soultide so I was interested in designing a machine learning algorithm that can complete this task. Of course, I have limited processing power with only my laptop and lack of data but it would be cool to tackle these problems and do a proof of concept. To accomplish this task I hope to: Find or scrape quality data from the web Look into implementing a transformer for higher quality model Find a good word/character embedding for chinese or create my own with machine learning Experiment with more complex model architecture.

item.title: Other past projects
item.description: training vs testing A simple project looking at convergence of model based number of neighbors. Link to Github LinReg plot A simple linear regression project looking at advertising vs sales. Link to Github LinReg plot The classic Titanic model that everyone has worked on when starting data science. Link to Kaggle Other Misc. Projects

item.title: Project 1: Arknights Class Clustering
item.description: A personal project exploring the character classes in a mobile game called Arknights after learning about unsupervised learning techniques. Cleaned and engineered data using domain knowledge Used a pipeline to scale data and implement KMeans algorithm to classify our game characters into groups Created a T-SNE mapping to visualize our clusters and see our results Experiment with different features to see if we can improve our result Vary the amount of clusters to see if we can pick up on different feature groupings Arknights classes Link to Kaggle notebook

item.title: Project 2: Machine Translation
item.description: A project to get me started with machine translation for a personal project that I want to work on later. In this project, we want to train a neural network to translate from english words to french words using a recurrent encoder-decoder structure and then feed it into a time-distributed dense layer. Create an embedding from english words to tensors Feed into an encoder (GRU network) Pass encoded vector to decoder and train network using teacher forcing (correct the output as it is generated word by word) Copy the weights of the decoder after training to create the final model.
